intro: Rubus ruderalis, commonly known as the rough blackberry, is a species of bramble native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its prickly stems and compound leaves, which are typically lobed and serrated. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are generally dark purple to black in color. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides and in wastelands. Rubus ruderalis is a hardy species that can tolerate a wide range of environmental conditions.
